section.title: Overview
section.para: This module offer the functionality of a presence user agent client, sending Subscribe and Publish messages.

Now it can be used with the following modules: pua_mi and pua_usrloc, pua_bla and pua_xmpp. The pua_mi offer the possibility to publish any kind of information or subscribing to a resource through fifo. The pua_usrloc module calls a function exported by pua modules to publish elementary presence information, such as basic status "open" or "closed", for clients that do not implement client-to-server presence. Through pua_bla , BRIDGED LINE APPEARANCE features are added to openser. The pua_xmpp module represents a gateway between SIP and XMPP, so that jabber and SIP clients can exchange presence information.
The module use cache to store presentity list and writes to database on timer to be able to recover upon restart.

libxml.

section.title: hash_size (int)
section.para: The size of the hash table used for storing Subscribe and Publish information. This parameter will be used as the power of 2 when computing table size.

section.title: db_table (str)
section.para: The name of the database table.

section.title: min_expires (int)
section.para: The inferior expires limit for both Publish and Subscribe.

section.title: default_expires (int)
section.para: The default expires value used in case this information is not provisioned.

section.title: update_period (int)
section.para: The interval at which the information in database and hash table should be updated. In the case of the hash table updating is deleting expired messages.

section.title: outbound_proxy (str)
section.para: SIP URI of outbound proxy to be used when sending PUBLISH requests.

para.emphasis: By default, no outbound proxy has been defined.

section.para: The remote target can be updated by the Contact of a subsequent in dialog request. In the PUA watcher case (sending a SUBSCRIBE messages), this means that the remote target for the following Subscribe messages can be updated at any time by the contact of a Notify message. If this function is called on request route on receiving a Notify message, it will try to update the stored remote target.
This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE.

section.title: Installation
section.para: The module requires 1 table in Kamailio database: pua. The SQL syntax to create it can be found in presence_xml-create.sql script in the database directories in the kamailio/scripts folder. You can also find the complete database documentation on the project webpage, &kamailiodbdocslink;.
